p: HRTEM micrographs and the size distributions of the recycled α-Fe 2O 3 particles are illustrated in Figure 4. It can be observed that initially the recycled α-Fe 2O 3 particles were loosely formed, randomly shaped and bulky. However, after 12 h of high-energy ball milling, nanoparticles with distinct aggregation and agglomeration were formed. The agglomeration could be due to higher particle–particle interaction arising from the increased specific surface area [ 19]. The nanoparticles were largely spherical and the sizes ranged from 10.3 to 24.45 nm with an average of 16.2 nm, consistent with the estimated crystallite sizes from the XRD analysis.
